title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
UNACCEPTABLE: Contains nothing that earns credit

o Mere restatement of the prompt

o Clearly does not respond to the prompt

o Not in Japanese

o Blank

VERY WEAK: Demonstrates lack of competence in presentational writing

· Task Completion

o Article addresses prompt only minimally

o Lacks organization and coherence

· Delivery

o Labored expression constantly interferes with comprehensibility

o Errors in orthography and mechanics are very frequent or significantly interfere with readability

o Minimal use of kanji according to the AP Japanese kanji list

o Constant use of register and style inappropriate to situation

· Language Use

o Insufficient, inappropriate vocabulary and idioms constantly interfere with comprehensibility

o Limited control of grammatical and syntactic structures significantly interferes with comprehensibility or results in very fragmented language

WEAK: Suggests lack of competence in presentational writing

· Task Completion

o Article addresses topic only marginally or addresses only some aspects of prompt

o Scattered information generally lacks organization and coherence; minimal or no use of transitional elements and cohesive devices

· Delivery

o Labored expression frequently interferes with comprehensibility

o Errors in orthography and mechanics are frequent or interfere with readability

o Frequent mistakes in use of kanji according to the AP Japanese kanji list

o Frequent use of register and style inappropriate to situation

· Language Use

o Insufficient, inappropriate vocabulary and idioms frequently interfere with comprehensibility

o Limited control of grammatical and syntactic structures frequently interferes with comprehensibility or results in fragmented language

ADEQUATE: Suggests emerging competence in presentational writing

· Task Completion

o Article addresses topic directly but may not address all aspects of prompt

o Portions may lack organization or coherence; infrequent use of transitional elements and cohesive devices

· Delivery

o Strained or unnatural flow of expression sometimes interferes with comprehensibility

o Errors in orthography and mechanics may be frequent or interfere with readability

o May include frequent mistakes in use of kanji according to the AP Japanese kanji list

o Use of register and style appropriate to situation is inconsistent or includes many errors

· Language Use

o Some inappropriate vocabulary and idioms interfere with comprehensibility

o Errors in grammatical and syntactic structures sometimes interfere with comprehensibility

GOOD: Demonstrates competence in presentational writing

· Task Completion

o Article addresses all aspects of prompt, including expression of preference and reasoning, but may lack detail or elaboration

o Generally organized and coherent; use of transitional elements and cohesive devices may be inconsistent

· Delivery

o Strained or unnatural flow of expression does not interfere with comprehensibility

o Errors in orthography and mechanics do not interfere with readability

o May include several mistakes in use of kanji according to the AP Japanese kanji list

o May include several lapses in otherwise consistent use of register and style appropriate to situation

· Language Use

o Appropriate but limited vocabulary and idioms

o Appropriate use of grammatical and syntactic structures, but with several errors in complex structures or limited to simple structures

VERY GOOD: Suggests emerging excellence in presentational writing

· Task Completion

o Article addresses all aspects of prompt, including expression of preference and reasoning

o Well organized and coherent, with a progression of ideas that is generally clear; some use of transitional elements and cohesive devices

· Delivery

o Generally exhibits ease of expression

o Infrequent or insignificant errors in orthography and mechanics

o Occasional mistakes in use of kanji according to the AP Japanese kanji list

o Consistent use of register and style appropriate to situation, except for occasional lapses

· Language Use

o Variety of vocabulary and idioms, with sporadic errors

o Appropriate use of grammatical and syntactic structures, with sporadic errors in complex structures

EXCELLENT: Demonstrates excellence in presentational writing

· Task Completion

o Article addresses all aspects of prompt with thoroughness and detail, including expression of preference and reasoning

o Well organized and coherent, with a clear progression of ideas; use of appropriate transitional elements and cohesive devices

· Delivery

o Natural, easily flowing expression

o Orthography and mechanics are virtually error-free

o Virtually no mistakes in use of kanji according to the AP Japanese kanji list

o Consistent use of register and style appropriate to situation

· Language Use

o Rich vocabulary and idioms

o Variety of appropriate grammatical and syntactic structures, with minimal or no errors
